definition[0]: an insurance arrangement that pays you a sum of money after an agreed period of time
definition[1]: an insurance policy where in return for a series of regular payments by the insured person, the insurer pays out a sum of money at the end of a specific period of time or when the insured person dies, if sooner
example[0]: He took out an endowment policy ten years ago to mature when he reached the age of sixty.
